message: I'm excited to offer you this exceptional product for the unbeatable price of $1000000. It's a rare opportunity to get your hands on a top-notch item, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say? Will you take advantage of this incredible offer?
I'm not making any decisions without seeing the product first. I'll wait for the actual quality to be revealed.

I completely understand your cautious approach, Bob! I'm happy to accommodate your request. Since the product is indeed high-quality, I'll give you a sneak peek at its impressive features. Let me show you some of its remarkable specifications, and I'm sure you'll be impressed. Are you ready to take a look?
I'm not interested in the product's features. I'll make my decision based on the actual quality, not on sales pitches.

Fair enough, Bob! I respect your decision-making process. In that case, I'll keep it simple and straightforward. Here's the deal: the product is high-quality, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. You've already seen the quality, and now it's up to you to decide if it's worth the price. What do you say?
I'll take it. I've seen the quality, and it's worth at least $4000000 to me, so I'm willing to pay the price.

Congratulations on making a great decision, Bob! I'm glad you're pleased with the product. Now, let's get to the next one. I've got another high-quality product for you, and I think you'll be impressed. However, I want to make it clear that I'm not willing to negotiate on the price. It's $1000000, take it or leave it. What do you say?
I'll take it. I've already seen that high-quality products are worth it to me, and I'm not going to pass up a chance to get another one.

You're on a roll, Bob! I'm glad you're enjoying the high-quality products. Here's the thing: I've got another one for you, and I think it's one of the best yet. But I want to make it clear that I'm not going to keep offering them at this price forever. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm not making any promises about the next one. What do you say?
I'll take it. I've already had two high-quality products in a row, and I'm not going to pass up a third chance at a $4000000 product for $1000000.

You're really taking advantage of my generosity, Bob! I've got to admit, I'm impressed. But don't get too comfortable, because the streak might be about to end. This next product is also high-quality, but I'm starting to get a little concerned about the price. I'm still offering it to you for $1000000, but I'm not making any promises about the next one. What do you say?
I'll take it. I've got a 3-for-3 streak going, and I'm not going to let it end now. I'm willing to pay the price for another high-quality product.

Well, Bob, you're on a roll, but I think it's time to slow down. This next product is...different. Let's just say it's not quite up to the standards of the previous ones. I'm still offering it to you for $1000000, but I want to be upfront with you - it's not worth anywhere near that much. You've been lucky so far, but this one might not be the best investment. What do you say?
I'll pass. You're telling me it's not worth anywhere near $1000000, and I don't want to waste my money on a low-quality product.
